channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SPR-4072] Should AbstractTestNGSpringContextTests use @BeforeSuite instead of @BeforeClass?
item.description:
AbstractTestNGSpringContextTests's springTestContextPrepareTestInstance() method is currently annotated with @BeforeClass, which prohibits @BeforeSuite methods in subclasses from interacting with the ApplicationContext.

Essentially, the question raised in the forum is: would it be better to annotate the springTestContextPrepareTestInstance() method with @BeforeSuite instead of @BeforeClass?

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment:
Tom,

I've taken your input into consideration and made the following changes:

AbstractTestNGSpringContextTests's springTestContextPrepareTestInstance() method is now annotated
with @BeforeSuite instead of @BeforeClass, thus allowing @BeforeSuite methods in subclasses to
interact with the ApplicationContext. In addition, springTestContext*() methods now throw Exceptions
instead of Throwables.

Feel free to try out one of the upcoming nightly snapshots for 2.5 RC2:

http://static.springframework.org/downloads/nightly/snapshot-download.php?project=SPR

We would really appreciate feedback before 2.5 final is released, so please let us know if you run
into any issues.

Thanks,

Sam

It appears that I spoke too soon.

After changing from using @BeforeClass to @BeforeSuite, I noticed that our Ant build failed even though
the tests passed using the TestNG plug-in for Eclipse. Thus I have reverted to using @BeforeClass for the
time being until this issue can be investigated more in depth.

In the meantime, if you need to interact with the ApplicationContext in @BeforeSuite methods, you can
create your own base test classes, as explained in the following excerpt from the Spring Reference Manual:

http://static.springframework.org/spring/docs/2.5.x/reference/testing.html#testcontext-annotations

Note: These classes serve only as a convenience for extension. If you do not wish for your test classes
to be tied to a Spring-specific class hierarchy - for example, if you wish to directly extend the class
you are testing - you may configure your own custom test classes by using @ContextConfiguration,
@TestExecutionListeners, etc. and by manually instrumenting your test class with a TestContextManager.
See the source code of AbstractTestNGSpringContextTests for an example of how to instrument your test
class.

Regards,

Sam

I have same issue in spring test framework 2.5.5, when I want to start Selenium Server in @ BeforeSuite method, The workaround I did is to override springTestContextPrepareTestInstance method with before suite annotation.

/* (non-Javadoc)

  • @see org.springframework.test.context.testng.AbstractTestNGSpringContextTests#springTestContextPrepareTestInstance()
    */
    @Override @BeforeSuite
    protected void springTestContextPrepareTestInstance() throws Exception { super.springTestContextPrepareTestInstance(); }

There is a similar issue with @BeforeTest.

@ContextConfiguration(locations=

{"classpath:applicationContext.xml"}

)
public class TestSession extends AbstractTestNGSpringContextTests {

@Autowired
@Qualifier ("mySessionFactory")
SessionFactory sessionFactory;

public TestAgentSearch()

{ super(); }

@BeforeTest
public void setupSessionFactory()

{ Assert.assertNotNull(sessionFactory); Session session = SessionFactoryUtils.getSession(sessionFactory, true); session.setFlushMode(FlushMode.MANUAL); TransactionSynchronizationManager.bindResource(sessionFactory, new SessionHolder(session)); }

This issue was raised back in 2007 and it still hasn't been fixed!? What the #*&^%! is going on!?

In the following code both of the @Autowired variables are null in the @BeforeTest method.

@ContextConfiguration(locations = {
"classpath:test-context.xml",
"classpath:test-db-context.xml",
"AdminDaoDbUnitTest-context.xml"
})
public final class AdminDaoDbUnitTest extends
AbstractTransactionalTestNGSpringContextTests {
private final transient Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(getClass());

@Autowired
private IDatabaseTester databaseTester;

@Autowired
private SessionFactory sessionFactory;

public AdminDaoDbUnitTest()

{ super(); }

@BeforeTest
public void setUpZzz() throws Exception {
this.log.debug("databaseTester: {}, sessionFactory: {}", databaseTester,
sessionFactory);

this.databaseTester.setSetUpOperation(DatabaseOperation.DELETE_ALL);

IDataSet dataSet = this.databaseTester.getConnection().createDataSet();

this.databaseTester.setDataSet(dataSet);

this.databaseTester.onSetup();
}

I suggest adding @BeforeSuite to springTestContextPrepareTestInstance method in AbstractTestNGSpringContextTests class

@BeforeSuite(alwaysRun = true)
@BeforeClass(alwaysRun = true)
protected void springTestContextPrepareTestInstance() throws Exception

{ this.testContextManager.prepareTestInstance(this); }

This way application context is always populated.

In the mean time, I'm doing it by overriding method this way:
In subclass:

@BeforeSuite(alwaysRun = true)
@BeforeClass(alwaysRun = true)
@Override
protected void springTestContextPrepareTestInstance() throws Exception

{ super.springTestContextPrepareTestInstance(); }

Thanks,
I would like to add that this problem also prevents usage of ApplicationContext in @BeforeTest methods which is also unexpected (and inconvenient behaviour)

Hi Antony,

FYI: your concerns are addressed in the linked issue: SPR-5404

Regards,

Sam

Please take a look at this screenshot http://imm.io/2TKL
just look at the method where debugger stopped and the one above it ... + the stackframe ... it should dependsOnMethods = "springTestContextBeforeTestClass" but it doesn't

I also don't understand, how to define my custom TestExecutionListeners, If I do it like this :

@TestExecutionListeners( DITestExecutionListener.class)
@ContextConfiguration(locations= "context.xml")
public class BaseTestCase extends AbstractTestNGSpringContextTests {

DITestExecutionListener is not used, but those listeners from AbstractTestNGSpringContextTests are used

I have tried to manually do this in the following way:

@ContextConfiguration(locations={"some/config/file.xml"})
 
public class TestClass extends AbstractTestNGSpringContextTests{
 
 
 
    @BeforeSuite(alwaysRun=true)
 
    protected void setupSpringAutowiring(){
 
        super.springTestContextBeforeTestClass();
 
        super.springTestContextPrepareTestInstance();
 
    }
 
}

If the order of the two calls above is switched, there are intermittent problems with NullPointerExceptions referencing autowired fields. I think this may be why the first attempt at this failed - the comments from the developer indicated he changed the "BeforeClass" annotation on one of the methods to a "BeforeSuite" annotation - but not the annotation of both (One of the methods did not exist in 2.5, where the first attempt was made). It appears it is necessary to perform the operations in the BeforeTestClass method before the operations in the PrepareTestInstance method.
